title: Executive looking for younger companion for something unique
text:
Giving this a try in the hope of find someone sane and like minded to share a new relationship.

I'll start by explaining that I recently met a superbly thoughtful and beautiful woman and although she and I get along very well we are not meant for romance (she works for me and this is a line I will not cross). Meeting her opened my eyes to the fact that a younger lady, despite her youth, can still posses a significant maturity and certainly a powerful charm.?

It makes sense to me that in this type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a SD (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 41 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being 18-35 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.?

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.?

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the financial rewards. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body and are you open to receive both affection and assistance with your bills and expenses and such? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.

title: Any LDS out there?
text:
So here's the deal...

I own two very successful businesses, I'm highly educated, I speak 3 foreign languages, and I'm exceedingly family oriented - if you want an attractive, successful, and dedicated man who places family and fatherhood at the center of his priorities, keep reading.

Wondering what the catch is yet?

I grew up in a largely LDS community, but I'm not Mormon myself. That said, I've got well over a dozen active LDS friends from school and my work in Washington DC, and at several points have considered joining the Church. So, you've got sincerity of respect for the church and interest in joining, that for several reasons just hasn't been acted upon yet.

More importantly though, I'm going to share something else driving my sincerity and interests: I've had several very disturbing revelations during my work overseas the last few years, which have left me with zero doubt that the Mormon Church is a citadel in God's plan, and that I need to look into becoming part of it.

No joke.

The revelations weren't some sort of waking vision or mystical dream, but they were very real, only more like being guided into a series of successively right places at the right times to be shown some very important things, in some incredibly unlikely ways. But they are very real and they certainly weren't pursued - they're the kinds of things where five minutes earlier or later, one life choice different, or one gut instinct not being listened to at any dozen places along my life, and I'd still be blind to it all.

All told, what you have with me is a dedicated, highly successful, globally experienced, family-oriented man who grew up surrounded by LDS types, who has exceptionally sincere and serious reasons for looking at joining your Church.

The only thing is, every time I've talked to one of your missionaries, the gut keeps telling me it's not right...yet. Same sense of danger I've had in bad places telling me to change course immediately, but very clearly with undertones telling me it's just not the right time yet, not the right way. Like I'm supposed to wait for someone else to guide me into the Church. It happens every time.

So...maybe I'm supposed to be looking for you. Or someone you know. That path feels very clear, and very right. A woman who may become my wife introducing me to the Church. I've survived and thrived by trusting my instincts, so I'm not going to question it.

Now, what would make you the right one for me?

You're professional, educated, and within a few years either way of 30. You've faithfully attended church and have been involved with it beyond Sundays, because it matters to you personally. You value family quite highly, you value home, you want a whole passel of kids, and you're kind of looking around wondering why in the heck you're not married yet.

You may suspect you're still single because you're a little too successful, but won't be lowering yourself to the point of wearing a skirt that's just a little too short to your singles ward. You have dignity, grace, and keep yourself put together well. Something along the lines of Molly Mormon meets Ann Taylor.

Importantly, here's what you want in a husband: you want him to be a man - an unapologetic leader, provider, protector, and standard-bearer for your values and that which matters. You want a man who is both socially sophisticated and refined, yet capable of efficiently handling the dirtiest of business a broken car, broken animal, or broken person could bring. You want a man who has no time for the childishness of video games, pornography, sports obsessions, or 'hanging out'. You want someone whom you can trust, rely upon, and have complete faith in - someone who excites you, mystifies you, makes you feel secure, and makes you feel content. Someone who brings happiness, laughter, life, love, and direction. You want a man of industry, resourcefulness, and perseverance. A man who approaches building family, community, and church involvement as mission - a mission that is at once joyous, consecrated, and not to be messed with.

So there you go. If you want family with a man of many layers, who will make you proud to have brought him into your church for the remainder of your life and possibly beyond, send an email. Get on it - tell me about you, what about my post here resonates, and send a photo or two. Hit me with yer best shot, Molly.

If this doesn't fit you, but you know someone in your life who this would resonate with, please pass it along to her.


EDIT: I've been asked a couple of times why I don't just got to a singles ward - the answer is that I'm not Mormon, and it wouldn't feel right at this point. Part of this post is to find someone for a romantic connection who can introduce me to the Gospel in greater detail over time, on my own time.

title: I want you to notice something interesting about yourself.
text:
What am I like? Before you read any further, I want you to notice something interesting about yourself. It's that feeling of curiosity. It's that warm, compelling feeling that makes you focus in a little deeper or move a little closer, to find out what you want to know. I'm a lot like so many people you've known and felt that curious feeling of familiarity, that "click" that tells you that you're in for something interesting. At this point, you might think, at some level, that you may know me - and in a sense, that would be true. There are men just like me you pass by every day - some you acknowledge, some you don't even remember. Some, like me, want to look you in the eyes and shake you, telling you "Wake up! Do you know what you are missing right this very moment?" There is something within you that only a few men have known, but something you want to share. The problem is that this "something" you have to keep safe and protect. It's that part of you where you keep your hopes and dreams and secret desires... those things you wouldn't even tell your closest friends. Most men only see your exterior. They would throw themselves at your feet to worship your physical beauty. But how many men do you know want to discover the real you, the woman that lays beneath that angel's body? How many men want to know your deepest desires, and nurture and protect them? All of that is possible... but you are the only one who can allow it to happen. There is something that happens, when you accept that you can have that fulfillment. A part of you wakes up, and comes alive. It's a part that knows and wants that passion, and no matter how hard you try to ignore it, it only grows stronger. It's a feeling so powerful that to have it, even if only for a moment, you know it could be locked away forever in your heart, and hold there safe, with all your fondest memories. You might recognize that feeling, when you reply... the feeling of your heart pounding... even now, wondering if you should do it. You might recognize it at that knock on the door. It's seven a. m., and you woke, because you knew he would be there for you ... all for you. And no one would know. But only you can make it happen. So you want to know about me? Here is one thing that you can be certain about - very little surprises me. In fact, the only thing that TRULY surprises me is someone who is caring and genuinely kind. I make a point to bring into my life as many of these rare people as possible. There is little more that I can say. Before I go, I know it's very likely you will never reply to this message and that it will be lost to time in that vast ocean of forgettings. If you don't reply - it will all be gone. Life is short. Because we don't know the end of life, we believe it's limitless, but it is not. You may live to see 1000 full moons.... but you may only see two ... or none at all. Life is short, and moments pass, never to return. If I came from your future to talk to you right now, I would say your life was good, you're happy ... but unfulfilled. You remember that personal ad, and you passed it up. You still wonder what would have happened if you didn't. 

I've come back to give you a second chance to find out.......... Send me a pic and let me know its you ;) 

R

title: Taking a chance
text:
Hi there! I hope you are doing well. I know I am just casting a line out into this vast ocean of Craigslist, but here goes. There is no hook on the end of the line, but I hope what I am throwing out tempts you to take a nibble and respond. By no means do I want to catch you. The line is merely a means of communication. 

I find myself at a very amazing place in life. It's new and exciting again. After hitting that point of what was pretty much a midlife crisis, I have a renewed zeal towards life and the experience of being a human on this planet. I am in my mid thirties, and I feel I have experienced multiple lifetimes of experiences. 

Over the last 10 years I have made some amazing shifts in my views on life, religion, happiness, relationships, family, friends, etc. It's like I am playing the game differently now. That's the way I see this life...as a game, or like a play. We are all actors here. Each day we pretend and perform different roles for different people and situations. We play these games of right and wrong, good and bad, black and white, etc. 

It's easy to get caught up in all of it, but if we can take a moment and be still, we can see things as they really are. We have one of those 'aha' moments where we find ourselves on the pinnacle of a very high mountain that allows us a vista from above the cloud cover. We see what we had to come through to get to that realization. At that moment, there is a tendency to want to remain, and not climb back down. But there is a curiosity that grips us, as we allow our gaze to drift to other visible peaks. We ask ourselves how we could get to those other peaks. For some, the fear and uncertainty of arriving to the next peak may be debilitating. You may choose instead to remain where you are. I can totally respect that. But maybe there comes a time where you feel complete with your experience on that mountain top, and you want to move on. Hopefully before the next peak you realize that it is not about the destination, but instead the journey. You find joy not only in reaching the top of the next peak, but also in the many paths that let you to that point. You feel gratitude for the overall experience, the 'good' with the 'bad'. You can see it as one complete picture. 

After coming to this realization that life is not what you were taught, you may feel lonely. You see things differently than those around you. It is disconcerting in the beginning, but if you can allow yourself some time, you learn to play the game again, but realize you can change certain aspects of it. I find myself at this phase of the game. Maybe you can relate with this, but if not, that's okay too. 

As I mentioned earlier, my views on relationships are quite different than they used to be. For example, I am married. I went into this union with the intention of upholding the promises and commitments that I made. We were very young, and religious, when we were married. We loved each other and felt a very strong connection. The part we didn't want to recognize going into it is that we had expectations for the marriage and for each other. We came in with our facades, and walls of protection, not to mention our secrets and unconfessed sins. We didn't know each other as well as we had presumed. 

Over time, your eyes, which were half shut going into the marriage, are slowly opened and you realize just how much you don't know each other. What an amazing experience that is! At this point some people give up and end it. They are hurt and feel betrayed, etc. Others just endure to the end, hoping they'll be happy in heaven if they can just get there with the marriage intact. Suffice to say, there are all kinds of different scenarios. Like I said before, my wife and I were very religious in a religion that is now a very popular Broadway musical... 

It is a long story, but very interesting if you ever get to hear it. The biggest conclusion that we came to together is that we both had unfulfilled dreams and desires. We both felt a little gypped that we hadn't experienced life a little more. The way we could deal with this fact was because of the religion we used to belong to. The idea of giving something up for a reward in heaven. I am rambling on here, obviously, so I'll get to the point. We have decided that in order to allow each other to feel complete with this life experience we are trusting each other to do what truly brings them happiness...however that gets to look. 

It's a very uncomfortable undertaking at times. We are finding that jealously arises, among other feelings of fear, etc. My wife's biggest worry is that I find someone that I love more than her, or that I might find that I am happier with someone else. I asked her the question of what if the opposite happened, and she found someone she felt more fulfillment with? I think that put it back into perspective that the purpose of doing this is to truly be happy. I am very happy in my relationship with my wife, and she with me. The love we have for each other is on a completely different level. 

One thing we learned from our marriage is that people change. Desires, hopes, dreams, interests, hobbies, friends, perspectives, etc. change. We are not the same people that we were when we got married. As we experienced life, we changed. It's as simple as that. 

Hopefully that gives you enough background. Now for the reason for the post. My wife and I agree that we can't give each other everything, all the time. I am not talking about any one thing here, I'm talking about anything and everything. Sometimes our interests are not the same. That is where these supplemental relationships come in. The tricky part of this is how do we avoid attachments to others, jealousy, fear, etc.? We have decided to work through it together by being open and honest. 

If you respond to this ad, and we begin a conversation that has substance and value...like there is a potential for a meaningful, rewarding relationship, I will let my wife know. If there are things that you prefer to keep just between us, then we can respect that, as long as the basic relationship is known. 

We're still figuring all of this out, so please ask any clarifying questions as needed. I think one of the most valuable benefits of this kind of relationship are the changes and improvements it can effect. It serves as a reminder to be thoughtful, considerate, loving, forgiving, etc. It's like an injection of all those awesome feelings and experiences that come from new relationships. It brings to mind the things we may have forgotten how to do. I hope this makes sense. I realize that this relationship is completely out of the norm. I had an experience recently where I met someone I really connected with, so much so that I thought I could be done posting on here, but the idea of an open relationship was too hard to get past for her. I am making an assumption here, but it seems that in her mind she thought she was going to ruin something. I just ask that you be open to other possibilities with this relationship. You are not going to ruin anything, because if you are not compatible you would never get that close in the first place. If are compatible and interested in the relationship you'll find friendship, and a loving, caring relationship.

Since my wife and I differ in the qualities and attributes we look for in a relationship, I am posting this ad for me...so here is a little about me. I am very genuine and open. I like to connect with people if they are willing. I don't care for idol chit chat. I like deep questions and well-formulated answers. I like running, hiking and just being outdoors. I don't mind being by myself, I enjoy moments of solitude. I like to cook. I like to clean the house. I enjoy affection - kissing, being close, holding hands, etc. I am a very passionate lover. I pay attention to detail, and like to observe other people. I like challenges. I face my fears. I strive to be comfortable in any situation, with any person(s). I am not religious, nor spiritual, but my thoughts and ideas are wide and varied. I can respect the beliefs of others. I don't affiliate myself with any group or idea. I like to be open to all things, in order to experience them freely and unrestricted. I like spending time with my wife and children. I like connecting with nature. I like writing, but don't do it enough. (Plenty here though! ;)) I am tall, athletic, adventurous. I enjoy learning about different cultures. I enjoy people. I am going to end this here, because I have written quite a bit more than I had intended. I hope it was interesting to read. I look forward to your response.

I guess that I should mention here that I would like to find someone compatible in age, intellect, education, passion, fitness level, etc. As we talk I hope to find many things we have in common, if we are not compatible, I want to be able to respectfully decline moving forward, without any hurt feelings. I hope you feel the same. I want there to be a mutual physical attraction as well. I would like to keep this discreet, as this is not something we share with everyone. I can send some pictures if there is a connection. Again, please respond with any questions and we can discuss them.

title: Not All Who Wander Are Lost (But I Am)
text:
Hello,

The chances of making a connection on the internet are, as we all know, slim to none. But there's nothing wrong with believing in miracles.

I'm 36, 6'3 and slim, with dark hair and blue eyes. I'm no Henry Cavill, but I like to consider myself a solid seven. There. Now that's out of the way.

I am, as the title implies, something of a wanderer. This is my third time living in Las Vegas. I've been to China, Denmark, Italy, Spain, India, and Indonesia. Never go to India, it's filthy. But Bali? Oh, my God, I love Bali...

Now for a bunch of random stuff about myself:

My background is in psychology and philosophy. I'm a self-published author, and sometimes teach Indonesian martial arts. I love motorcycles, though I don't have one anymore (I miss you, Snow). I collect swords, carry a Sig, and somehow still read Calvin & Hobbes. I'm trying to start my own business here, or two of them, actually, which is a really optimistic way of saying I don't have a job right now. I'm tired of working for someone else, and decided hanging a sword over my skull like Damocles was the best way to take that leap. So here it goes. I'm one leap-taking son of a gun.

Oh, I bleed red, meaning, I'm a Republican. If you're a fan of either Sanders or Clinton, you should probably keep searching. If you're not a fan of Trump, we're still okay, because neither am I.

Finally, what I'm looking for:

I don't necessarily want to get into something permanent right now. However, I'm also 36, and one night stands just aren't my style anymore. I want someone I can talk to, who finds my sarcasm entertaining instead of offensive, who can make me laugh, and who has a curious mind. You need to be able to keep up with me mentally, but not in that half-baked know-it-all college girl kind of way. Physically, I tend to date out of my league. What's the point of having low expectations, anyway? I'm a slim guy, and I like a girl who's in shape. That doesn't mean you need to be able to bench press me. Quite honestly, if your shoulders are bigger than mine, it might make me question who's going to be on top (and it should be me). I do like curves, especially of the northern variety, so long as 'curves' isn't being used as a code word for 'fat'. And I grew up in a white-washed steel town full of blondes, and I hated it. Give me the dark-haired, dusky siren any day. A playful, pretty smile and a Coke-bottle body will melt me like ice on a summer day. Can you whisper in my ear in Spanish? Even better...

You need to be clean, and reasonably not crazy. A little crazy is kind of alluring, but a lot of crazy? Not so much. Oh, and I hate, hate, hate drugs. My brother died from that stuff, and you'll never convince me it's anything but poison. If you're 420 friendly, we're just going to fight. Or we would, if you weren't high as a kite.

Oh, and I'm pretty easy-going, just don't play games with me. Shoot straight. I'm a big boy, and I'm not made of glass. Trust me, I can take it.

I hope to hear from you soon.

title: Not All Who Wander Are Lost (But I Am)
text:
Hello,

The chances of making a connection on the internet are, as we all know, slim to none. But there's nothing wrong with believing in miracles.

I'm 36, 6'3 and slim, with dark hair and blue eyes. I'm no Henry Cavill, but I like to consider myself a solid seven. There. Now that's out of the way.

I am, as the title implies, something of a wanderer. This is my third time living in Las Vegas. I've been to China, Denmark, Italy, Spain, India, and Indonesia. Never go to India, it's filthy. But Bali? Oh, my God, I love Bali...

Now for a bunch of random stuff about myself:

My background is in psychology and philosophy. I'm a self-published author, and sometimes teach Indonesian martial arts. I love motorcycles, though I don't have one anymore (I miss you, Snow). I collect swords, carry a Sig, and somehow still read Calvin & Hobbes. I'm trying to start my own business here, or two of them, actually, which is a really optimistic way of saying I don't have a job right now. I'm tired of working for someone else, and decided hanging a sword over my skull like Damocles was the best way to take that leap. So here it goes. I'm one leap-taking son of a gun.

Oh, I bleed red, meaning, I'm a Republican. If you're a fan of either Sanders or Clinton, you should probably keep searching. If you're not a fan of Trump, we're still okay, because neither am I.

Finally, what I'm looking for:

I don't necessarily want to get into something permanent right now. However, I'm also 36, and one night stands just aren't my style anymore. I want someone I can talk to, who finds my sarcasm entertaining instead of offensive, who can make me laugh, and who has a curious mind. You need to be able to keep up with me mentally, but not in that half-baked know-it-all college girl kind of way. Physically, I tend to date out of my league. What's the point of having low expectations, anyway? I'm a slim guy, and I like a girl who's in shape. That doesn't mean you need to be able to bench press me. Quite honestly, if your shoulders are bigger than mine, it might make me question who's going to be on top (and it should be me). I do like curves, especially of the northern variety, so long as 'curves' isn't being used as a code word for 'fat'. And I grew up in a white-washed steel town full of blondes, and I hated it. Give me the dark-haired, dusky siren any day. A playful, pretty smile and a Coke-bottle body will melt me like ice on a summer day. Can you whisper in my ear in Spanish? Even better...

You need to be clean, and reasonably not crazy. A little crazy is kind of alluring, but a lot of crazy? Not so much. Oh, and I hate, hate, hate drugs. My brother died from that stuff, and you'll never convince me it's anything but poison. If you're 420 friendly, we're just going to fight. Or we would, if you weren't high as a kite.

Oh, and I'm pretty easy-going, just don't play games with me. Shoot straight. I'm a big boy, and I'm not made of glass. Trust me, I can take it.

I hope to hear from you soon.

title: I want you to notice something interesting about yourself.
text:
What am I like? Before you read any further, I want you to notice something interesting about yourself. It's that feeling of curiosity. It's that warm, compelling feeling that makes you focus in a little deeper or move a little closer, to find out what you want to know. I'm a lot like so many people you've known and felt that curious feeling of familiarity, that "click" that tells you that you're in for something interesting. At this point, you might think, at some level, that you may know me - and in a sense, that would be true. There are men just like me you pass by every day - some you acknowledge, some you don't even remember. Some, like me, want to look you in the eyes and shake you, telling you "Wake up! Do you know what you are missing right this very moment?" There is something within you that only a few men have known, but something you want to share. The problem is that this "something" you have to keep safe and protect. It's that part of you where you keep your hopes and dreams and secret desires... those things you wouldn't even tell your closest friends. Most men only see your exterior. They would throw themselves at your feet to worship your physical beauty. But how many men do you know want to discover the real you, the woman that lays beneath that angel's body? How many men want to know your deepest desires, and nurture and protect them? All of that is possible... but you are the only one who can allow it to happen. There is something that happens, when you accept that you can have that fulfillment. A part of you wakes up, and comes alive. It's a part that knows and wants that passion, and no matter how hard you try to ignore it, it only grows stronger. It's a feeling so powerful that to have it, even if only for a moment, you know it could be locked away forever in your heart, and hold there safe, with all your fondest memories. You might recognize that feeling, when you reply... the feeling of your heart pounding... even now, wondering if you should do it. You might recognize it at that knock on the door. It's seven a. m., and you woke, because you knew he would be there for you ... all for you. And no one would know. But only you can make it happen. So you want to know about me? Here is one thing that you can be certain about - very little surprises me. In fact, the only thing that TRULY surprises me is someone who is caring and genuinely kind. I make a point to bring into my life as many of these rare people as possible. There is little more that I can say. Before I go, I know it's very likely you will never reply to this message and that it will be lost to time in that vast ocean of forgettings. If you don't reply - it will all be gone. Life is short. Because we don't know the end of life, we believe it's limitless, but it is not. You may live to see 1000 full moons.... but you may only see two ... or none at all. Life is short, and moments pass, never to return. If I came from your future to talk to you right now, I would say your life was good, you're happy ... but unfulfilled. You remember that personal ad, and you passed it up. You still wonder what would have happened if you didn't. 

I've come back to give you a second chance to find out.......... Send me a pic and let me know its you ;) 

R

title: Businessman looking for younger companion for something unique
text:
Giving this a try in the hope of find someone sane and like minded to share a new relationship.

I'll start by explaining that I recently met a superbly thoughtful and beautiful woman and although she and I get along very well we are not meant for romance (she works for me and this is a line I will not cross). Meeting her opened my eyes to the fact that a younger lady, despite her youth, can still posses a significant maturity and certainly a powerful charm.?

It makes sense to me that in this type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a SD (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 41 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being 18-35 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.?

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.?

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the financial rewards. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body and are you open to receive both affection and assistance with your bills and expenses and such? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.

title: So what do you say? Let's drive a little and invest A LOT!
text:
I first want to be clear and point out that I live in the St. George, Utah area. It's only a 1 1/2 hour drive north of Vegas. Some people think it's the other end of the world! I drive back n' forth and the time flies rather quickly. It's not so far away ... truly. The reason I posted my ad in the Vegas area is because there are no (what I consider to be) quality women in my area. I am also hoping there's someone that shares my passion for all the cool outdoor activities my area has to offer. I live near Zion Nat'l Park. I am hoping for a lady that would consider the idea of traveling to me, and I would travel to her in return. It would be great to be able to spend quality time together at our separate locations! Why not right?! If you would consider the idea then please, by all means read forward!

First of all, it took me months to arrive at this desperate attempt to find you. But hey, here it goes.

I took the time to read a lot of the ads that other guys posted (thought I could cheat a bit and get a few ideas) and thought WHAT THE _ _ _ _?! It's a bit hard for me to believe any of them are truly serious about any form of a monogamous relationship and clearly, they're not. Me ... I am serious. 

I've been a single dad for so many years and so very tired of seeing the holidays come and go feeling alone. I can handle birthdays alone and most major holidays but Valentines Day had always been tough. (It's taken me since Feb. 14th to muster up the guts to draft this.) I'm tired of feeling like a third wheel when visiting my couple friends. The whole thing sucks and here's my attempt to well, fix the empty feeling I've grown used to. Listen to Dan Fogelberg's song "The Last to Know" if you want to catch a glimpse of how I really and truly feel. Heck take a minute, Google it, and listen to it anyway cause it's a great song!

I'm 51, look younger (truly I do), and certainly act younger too. No stiff old attitude here! I don't mind saying I am also quite successful. Please don't confuse money with my definition of success. I have lived through most difficult times and hold my head high and proud for the many hardships I have encountered and conquered. Most cannot believe my life story. Between this and my devotion toward my relationship with my family this qualifies me for my personal level of success. On another subject all together, I built my own large custom home on 5 acres and live in a somewhat rural setting. It's a rather fantastic house. I can go into the material side of my life but that's not realistic. At least not to me. The message I attempt to portray here is that I am settled and serious about personal goals. I am fit (physically and mentally) and prefer to be with a woman that also takes pride in her outer appearance. I truly hope that statement doesn't offend anyone. I am more of a home body and really enjoy cooking and entertaining. Being a single dad for so long I am rather seasoned at cooking and entertaining ... no pun intended ha ha.

Anyway, I could go on and on about me but I am already feeling like I've over done things here. Should anyone feel like there's a connection let me know okay? Hey, some good ol' fashion company would be really refreshing. Internet communication for starters would be nice. A personal meeting is always welcomed should there be that special connection. Wouldn't you agree? 

If you are serious and feel the same way I do please contact me. Again, PLEASE be serious. I have had a lot of women that have responded that have not been entirely ready for this opportunity.I can't wait to hear from you, and thanks for reading my mini biography.

P.S. "Please be serious about your situation". I have received A LOT of responses from women who are lonely but not quite ready for a relationship. Also, NO ENDLESS EMAILS, NO TEXTING. Thanks for understanding.

title: Simple and loyal guy
text:
I'm a pretty down to earth guy with a great sense of humor. I like living a healthy lifestyle, staying in shape, and taking care of my body. I don't drink alcohol, do drugs, smoke, or club/party at all. None of that lifestyle ever seemed attractive to me, and I love and enjoy my life just fine without any of it. I would really love to meet someone who shares that same philosophy, or at least, close to it.

I try to always be honest with everyone and like to think of myself as someone loyal and dependable. I'm really good with communication, I usually reply to texts or calls right away, and like to pride myself on never leaving someone hanging. I always thought it would be nice to have someone to talk to that can always get back to me and never forgets about me, so that's what I try myself to do.

I was an automotive mechanic for the last 3 years for Subaru but decided to go back to working in the computer industry which was always one of my strong sides. I'm currently building up my resume to hopefully go work for one of the giant tech companies like Google or Apple one day. I currently work full time as a Lead Systems Technician for a computer repair company, and I'm pretty good at it!

I also like to pride myself on having very good manners and morals and always being polite with people. I don't really curse or act crude around people, and always just try to be nice and go out of my way to do nice things. I always like opening the door for my girlfriend or always saying my thank you's and what not. You don't really see many people in the world these days like that so I think it's important to make the world a little nicer.

I'm not a huge social bug, I'm not one of those people that have tons of friends or is always going out and doing social events. I have a very select few really good friends that live similar lifestyles and I know I can count on and will always have my back. I'm more the type of person that enjoys spending most of my time going places with my girlfriend, going on road trips, theme parks, random adventures, or staying in just relaxing watching movies.

To sum things up, I'm looking for a serious and lasting relationship. No hook-ups or one night stands. I often tend to be attracted to shorter petite brunettes who are sweet and affectionate. Not interested in dating someone who has kids, and I don't want to have kids either. I'd love to just meet a girl, fall in love, get married, travel and enjoy our lives together going on adventures and not worry about anything else.


Bonus Random Facts: I have a cat that I love. I'm trying to go vegan. I build and fly racing fpv quadcopters. I can make cricket sounds.

title: Businessman looking for younger companion for something unique
text:
Giving this a try in the hope of find someone sane and like minded to share a new relationship.

I'll start by explaining that I recently met a superbly thoughtful and beautiful woman and although she and I get along very well we are not meant for romance (she works for me and this is a line I will not cross). Meeting her opened my eyes to the fact that a younger lady, despite her youth, can still posses a significant maturity and certainly a powerful charm.?

It makes sense to me that in this type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a SD (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 41 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being 18-35 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.?

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.?

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the financial rewards. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body and are you open to receive both affection and assistance with your bills and expenses and such? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.

title: the honest truth about dating in Vegas
text:
as observed by a very intelligent person, me.

The dating scene here in Las Vegas is unbelievable. I've never been through the things I've been through with people that I meet here in this city. If it's not an alcohol or drug problem, it's lying and cheating, or it's some kind of judgement on my personality.

Now I understand, we all go through our own fair share of nonsense in life. And I take this into consideration being in this city when I talk to new people. but things seem to be not only boring and repetitive, but also getting out of control in terms of specifics. and the walls that we build are so thick that me personally shyt, I put my chip axe and Jack Hammer back in the fucking closet.

I Know Who I am, what I'm about, what makes me tick, what I like, what I don't like like, etc. I am also one who will not settle and when I meet someone who fits what makes me happy. What this means is, I'm not going to settle for your vagina just because I want vagina. that's not how it works for me. I've been here for over three years and I would say that right now, this city is not for me. I am a good hearted and kind person with good intentions at every turn. I communicate clearly and concisely. Especially if I like you. I want to let you know all about me. But it seems that even if I give you an instruction manual on how I operate in life you'll still find a way to pick it apart.

The truth is I am lonely. I deserve someone beautiful and kind. Free spirit with an open mind. Someone who understands a god damn artist. What I don't need, is one of these people who was enthralled by Who I am and what I do, but then tried it stifle it somehow because you're jealous. If you want to go do something in life then go do it don't sit around like a lazy asshole then try to limit my growth as a human because you just don't know to do it yourself.

I guess most people are intimidated by my brain I have no idea. Or how about this theory, I think I'm so easy to deal with that people don't know how to deal with it. I don't cause drama I don't do drugs I don't barely ever drink. I'm not a cheater I don't even go to strip clubs. I'm very laid back and chill and takes a lot stress me out in terms of a relationship. but I guess people need drama in their lives so they build up some kind of negativity, or create some kind of nonsense that doesn't need to exist.

You are all fools. yes, even all the men. Are you people tired of this routine of playing games, and building walls, then play more games, and build more walls?

The last woman I was talking to here accused me of having a second secret life. I'm like what the heck? Trying to have one life here is hard enough let alone factoring in some secret life like come on people. oh yeah and then she suspected me of being a drug addict. needless to say I up my towel and threw it in the ring as I'm done. The girl I dated before that, an alcoholic. And the girl I loved prior, a crazy monster alcoholic. like some of the stuff is no joke it is serious. and you're running around the city like its nothing. you're affecting people's lives negatively.

I'm sort of old school. Into romance and things like that. I know I'm a sweet person. and I know I respect the people that I talk to. My wants from another person are clear and concise. I'm not in this for sex. I'm in this the way my head next to somebody at night so I feel comfortable. So I feel appreciated. To feel loved. Is that so much to ask from you people? Some of you act all cool but then one day wake up like someone jammed a stick in your vagina and you freak out. I can't tell you how many times I find myself feeling at the end of a relationship here questioning my own merit and self worth, when I don't need to be doing that. Because I know who the fuck I am.

So what's the deal? Can you tell me? No? Okay, I'll tell you. Cut to the chase. It seems from my perspective, regardless of man or woman, everybody wants to hook up but nobody wants to admit it. I seem to be the only man in this city looking to hold someone's hand and fall in love with them. but then again, I've been through so much crap, that I don't even trust people anymore. I could meet you, we could fall in love, and three months later you can wake up and tell me you don't love me anymore and run off with somebody else. Seems to be the norm here.

I'm at the point that when the night time comes I get so sad that I just stare at the city skyline shaking my head, asking myself, why did I ever come to this place? But I know why I came here. And I know exactly what I gave up to come here to do what I do. I went through enough personal loss by making the decision to come to this city without needing the insecurities of others, or they're broken hearts and lives piling on top of me. I've never met so many single mothers in this city in my life. And it actually makes me angry. there seems to be a lot of assholes out there sticking their dicks in vaginas without taking responsibility for their actions. Now I find myself talking to women and realizing that I have to consider taking on their children. And that's not really fair to me is it? Chances are I take on that decision in the woman I'm with you treat me like garbage here.

Now, I have no criminal history. And never done hard drugs in my life. but my relationships here with seemingly normal people have made me feel like a criminal drug pushing fool. and I'm getting angry just writing this. And it's not fair for me to be angry it's not really what I want to be in life. But you all made me angry.

There should be a Las Vegas app for my phone that pretty much is a map showing me where every crazy person is so I could avoid them. but if that did exist, it would pretty much push me to the outskirts of the city because it seems like everyone is crazy here.

The last woman I talked to, the one accused me of doing drugs, I bet you she's banging my pot dealer right now. By the way, marijuana is not a drug.

So I don't know what to tell any of you. My experiences with the lot of you it made me completely lonely, Broken me on the inside, I'm getting angry from the anxiety and borderline depression that's forming out of loneliness. I'm pretty sure this post will get flagged purely based on the intelligence of the writer being taken as an insult by the reader. But that's fine I'll save a copy of this for my archives.

Please stop judging me. Please stop picking apart my personality. you have no right to do that especially when I show you respect and not judge you. please stop all the whining that you can't find real men when you end up pushing them away anyway. besides, syphilis is on the rise here in the city because all the men are banging each other. because they have nowhere else to go. Because dating here sucks.

I don't know, I'm planning on getting out of here soon. There's been enough damage done to my personal well-being to write three books worth of bull. Nobody is perfect. I know I'm not. but I am really close too perfect. And I'm not saying this with an ego I'm being true to myself and true to you.

Will see around the bend. That's if don't hang myself first from the loneliness created out of broken hearts, broken dreams, and sore genitals.

title: "It is our CHOICES that show us what we truly are...
text:
...far more than our abilities."
*THIS POST IS MEANT TO INSPIRE AND PROMOTE CRITICAL THINKING*



Thought:

To think. Craigslist and the whole online concept in general...and who it attracts. How people go online expecting a relationship (something in general) from those they have yet to meet (and spend time with in person)....darn those wants and expectations. 
Perhaps they are the same people who treat relationships like "cell phones". Never being dedicated nor appreciative for what is because all the while, they're waiting for the next best thing to come around. Meantime, they drop 'm (mistreat) yet RAGE at the "phone" or blame "service" because it does not work? Unless you have Metro, that is a sign of some SERIOUS issues and lack of responsibility/reality.



Then you have the ones who "only got on here to laugh at articles" (so they say). Let's just buy into that stupid excuse. You mean to say that your life is so grand, so great...you are taking the time to "laugh at the others" who are doing something most are not willing due to fear of judgment? Which is what: Put yourself out there in an effort to find something??? (whatever that may be)

..........seriously, why make a simple thing so complicated....

You are here for a reason. So unless someone forced you against your will (for some psycho reason), don't play yourself. KEEP IT REAL! For it will help you find some depth/meaning with what you seek.



Now, don't get me wrong. Some of these craigslist postings are hilarious but those are people purposely crying for attention...in a unique way...very unique. But hey, I don't knock them for trying quite honestly. It isn't easy putting yourself out there even when you may not know what you are doing or ever been forced to look at yourself.

No one hands you a book with "How to put yourself out there on Craigslist" and even if someone did? Who is to say it would fit you perfectly? There is so much to every one of us...so I'd like to believe...so how else will you know unless you try?


I would like to believe there are some who take it seriously and genuinely trying to find something from nothing which is not an easy task. Most start online because the judgment and rejection is not something everyone can take nor handle...especially when it is in your face. Direction can be questionable with some being too critical, impatient, inexperienced and some being too careless. So many possibilities... Is the direction/meaning in hopes of some kind of happiness? Maybe. For some it can be pure boredom (attention of some sort), unfortunately.


We all have different views though, so...what is "happiness"? Do we all share the same definition? Have we ever had a taste of it and if so, was it real or was it a compromise?


Well, we haven't a clue of happiness if we've never been sad or down. And hey, we have our reasons for reading these things...and I'm sure they are along those lines. If not, we would be busy living life and doing our own thing far away from this chaos, right? But I'll tell you this, there many people out there who have never thought to think this way due to denial/fear of reality. So don't fool yourself thinking because they've never bothered that they are perfect. HAHA! ...no one is.


"Ignorance is bliss."


Most people seem to be distracted from what really matters. With television, internet and bad family/parenting (lack of guidance/positivity), things have just lost their meaning with time leaving lost people to make their own - forcing the blind to lead the blind.



So "Craigslister"... WHAT IN THE WORLD IS GOING ON AROUND HERE?! Eh, we can go on forever with that. But you...what do you search for... and why?


I have been on here for quite a while posting this. It is all in hopes it will encourage readers to seek some direction or....discover a kind of hope. Let's just say I'm a nice guy simply trying to help. Because to know what I do now and NOT share it? I wouldn't be who I am today if those who came across my path never shared their wisdom. We are all just people trying to figure things out; ourselves and this world around us just to find a "meaning".


Craigslist has shown me that those who like to read are the ones who are most willing to try (more often than not). But care? Understand? Comprehend? That all varies by perception and experience. That is where it is important to educate yourself and take on certain experiences that will benefit your mind/body.


Here is something else I've learned:
The majority of visitors on here are searching for the best bull sh...illusion ever. One that has been fed by advertisements, fashion, maybe even some (ignorant/immature) family/friends and the entertainment industry... PERFECTION!


All the while you're making yourself insecure at someone else's benefit, You're left confused/distracted. Chasing dreams rather than the meaning of them...and what they even mean TO you. We care about what something looks like or what SOMEONE ELSE THINKS rather than what it's made of or how it makes one FEEL.


No one is perfect (that includes you & I) and the day you realize that, you will be one step closer to finding some sort of direction toward some sort of belief. After that will come happiness. Happiness will bring love from within but you gotta understand and find it within yourself. So don't go wasting your time on "looks" or "money" because time will diminish that...and what will you have then?


Understanding, compromise and respect are essential...and they truly start with yourself.


"You can't help me, if you can't help yourself."



Call me old school but isn't that what a relationship should be all about?

Helping one another? To help stay focused, on track, happy, healthy and being there for one another in hopes of betterment during hardships while keeping the other person's interests at heart? Or maybe better put: "Relationship: Two people who accept one another's past, supports the present and encourages the future."


I come to think of a partner as being in a "partnership". Saying, "I got your back and you have mine." Something... that took a genuine mutual belief that enriched bond or connection which fueled team effort in hopes of sharing one another's world (then a home) and prosper together.

Once that was accomplished, "traditionally" (not saying it's a MUST because kids are not objects nor does it make you "a real parent", "mature", "responsible", "respectable" nor "accomplished"), they would then raise a child or two (seriously, if you have more kids than you have hands, you have problems or you are a freak) to share what they have found in life. To keep that...that "fire" alive or pass something down? Maybe that is Disney stuff.


Again, not to say you NEED to have kids to be "respectable" or "accomplished", not at all. Honestly, many are not meant to have kids and best if they don't. I really respect those who acknowledge and make that choice. I feel finding someone you can grow old with and be genuinely happy is key. And that should not have to be "justified" or proven by marriage or kids. It should be by the effort and time together with all happiness to show for it every day possible.


...goodness! Sounds like a lot of work! But as they say (don't ask who is "they"):


 "When you love what you do, you never work a day in your life." 


Love, in my opinion, is about appreciation, not possession. So if you NEED to get married or have kids to feel validated? Something is seriously wrong and really must take a look in the mirror. 


Murphy's law:  "Anything that can go wrong, will go wrong." 



Maybe I have it all wrong. But what I do know and have right from experience, is that if you want something meaningful and amazing? It takes time, trials, effort and strong communication on both parts. Dedication that should blossom into passion. And anything that is fast and easy, is more than likely not worth having because everyone would have it. And if anyone can have it, I'm not sure if it'd be THAT special or meaningful. For anything worth having never comes easy.

So many people looking for "fast & easy" love...and look at where that has gotten most people? Welcome to single parenthood...thanks, mom & dad! (...it is always best to blame some on else...kidding but if there is anything, I blame marketing)



Dating will go as they come. If it's really fast... what can you expect other than it to leave just as fast?

(or be very fragile)



I wish everyone all the best and hope this all helps with some direction in your life. Because you came on and read these pages for a reason.


Note when reading these things:

The larger the post, the more you have to go by when you meet and see how full of shit they could be.

The smaller the post, you can expect the meaning to be just as insignificant (or spam).



Besides...it is better to say too much, then never to say what you need to say. :)



Want something real? Find out what that is and keep it real.
Because we all have hope. That's what TRULY brought you to craigslist. And when two people strongly believe in the same thing, that is called potential!


Just keep your head up or a good thing could pass you by for even I am still searching for my other half...I just had to know myself a whole lot better in order to get an idea of it. Weird though, because when I think about it? I never thought...that the other half of ME...has a vagina, haha! Maybe yours has one as well...that's cool too. Sucks for straight guys but hey, BE HAPPY!!


If you love what is true, the world will come to you but remember, it starts with yourself. And to take a look at yourself and make a change for the better is not easy, let alone accepting what needs to be changed but know you attract what you put out. Not all the time but: 

 "Real will recognize real." 


So don't be a fool placing "requirements", "limits" or "expectations" on love. Because love does not have a face nor eyes. It has a heart. It feels. And true love, is very similar to life. It's not something you "find easily" or ask for, it's given to you...out of no where. But ya better believe, it will take a whole lot of hard work and dedication which sadly, not many are willing to do.


 "Not anyone can be a great person, but a great person can come from anywhere." 





Thank you for reading. Much love and best of luck to everyone.





If you truly enjoyed this and would like to show support or keep up with more of these kinds of things to come (please be patient), feel free to look me up on book with faces and tube of you under "NESTOsterone".


I recently moved to LA to share all this in the form of stand up comedy so please be patient as I take my words of wisdom to the motherland of shallow!

title: 23 year old male, new to the area.
text:
Well, hey there. So, here we are -- on craigslist. If popular culture has taught us anything that means we're both really lonely, really desperate or even both. But where would my sense of adventure be if not guiding me through the perilous depths of craigslist personals/romance? I'd be at some bar or some such place drinking and performing rap karaoke of songs like Get Low and Rap God. I think to protect the world from that I'll stay on craigslist for now and see what happens. So, about me:

I'm a 23 year old male that enjoys writing, reading, video games, netflix (well, TV in general), the bar, doing inappropriate rap karaoke and I'm a huge animal lover. I'm equally comfortable shouting my drink order over the crowd of a hundred people all drunkenly ranting and rambling as I am in shorts and a 5 year old band t-shirt eating questionable chinese food on the couch binge watching House of Cards. I'm essentially your versatile boyfriend experience, capable of interesting adventure and boring albeit comforting complacency at home. 

I do work, and I do drive. I moved to the area to get away from the cold of Michigan, where I was born and raised in the suburbs of Detroit. I've already found employment here and I'm going to continue college out here, going to school for business administration. When it comes to my interest in writing, my hope is that I can eventually break into television writing and say "Well, college... we had a good run, but you were a waste of time in reality" while I go on to work for HBO, or even comedy central. That'd be nice, but if not I'm fine with being a corporate sell out and sign a contract of my soul to the big business 'devil.' 

I'm really hoping to find someone that isn't all cynical about the area yet. I've met a few ladies already that simply hate Las Vegas and want to move away as soon as possible, but I'm happy here for now. I want to walk the strip a couple dozen times, gamble at the casinos until I'm kicked out, get a little tipsy on Fremont and eat a coney at the little 'restaurant' adjacent to The D hotel and complain to you that it just isn't as good as a real coney from back home. All that sort of stuff. 

If you've found my post at all interesting then good, email me. Maybe we can catch a cup of coffee, meet up at Fremont Street or go see Deadpool because I really don't want to go see it alone but I will if I have to, damn it. 

Put "My favorite place to visit is ____" (the ___ being your favorite place to visit) in your subject line so I know you're not a robot hellbent on getting me to sign up for some sort of 'singles website' loaded with enough malware to destroy NASA.

title: Dream Date!
text:
It is early morning as you are on the way to the airport, sitting in the back of the SUV he sent for you, you see the sun rising . You notice as you drive to the airport the crystal blue skies as the sun rises to start a new day! 

As you pull up the gate opens to let you on the airport grounds you pull around and notice the Falcon jet waiting, door open and steps down. The drivers stops and comes around to open your door and let you out of the SUV. The pilot walks over to greet you and helps with your bag. He takes your light bag and let's you climb aboard the waiting jet. Excited you take your first step into the jet not sure what is around the corner but willing to find out.

You turn to the right and pass the galley. The aircraft is larger than you pictured it from outside. You notice seating for 8. All you really care about is seating for 2. You sit down and wait for your date, looking through a magazine as you wait. 

Your date boards the aircraft; he is tall 6', 175 lbs, blue eyes, athletic build, great smile, he gives you a firm hug and a kiss. You sit down in the plush leather chairs and notice the flowers on the table in front of you. In it is a card that reads. "Welcome aboard, this is the start of a great ride" 

It is 6.30, early yet perfect to take off to destination unknown. 

You have talked to him on the phone, met for drinks and emailed over a period of time and feel you have really gotten to know him, you feel comfortable with him and are ready for this new, fun and exciting adventure. 

The pilot gives you a quick rundown on the safety features shuts the door and heads to the flight deck. You hear the 3 engines start and you slowly start to head out towards the runway. 

You Taxi to the North and stop just short of the runway, it is a wonderful day for flying. You watch as other planes land and you see the small Cessna in front of you head down the run way to take off. 

The Plane slowly makes a turn to the active runway pointing south. You hear the engines getting louder and you slowly start to roll you feel the force of this wonderful aircraft take you down the runway. It seems like only a minute and you 
are airborne! The city is below you as you climb out. 

The climb-out is smooth, the sun is shining and the clouds look like candy as you climb out. You notice that the aircraft is turning to the East. Once again you ask yourself where I am going. 

The conversation is great. You both are comfortable talking about anything and everything from kids to family to dreams. You laugh and enjoy each others company. 

As the plane reaches cruise the screens around the aircraft light up to show where you are and where the closest towns are, it lets you know speed but fails to give you a location of where you will wind up. 

You have a light breakfast and a toast of Champagne to start the day. 

You wonder where we are going. Did I pack the right clothes.... 

In the end it does not matter, you know in your heart you have finally found him. The ride on the plane is like the ride of life, a few bumps along the way.

It does not matter how many bumps there are as long as the person sitting next to you is holding your hand. 

Life is short, enjoy the ride!

All good negotiations are never one sided, however. So I propose a "If you (Blank) then I will (Blank)" proposition. Example: "If you buy dinner then I'll wear my low cut shirt and lean in a little extra when I reach for the salt."

title: Businessman looking for younger companion for something unique
text:
Giving this a try in the hope of find someone sane and like minded to share a new relationship.

I'll start by explaining that I recently met a superbly thoughtful and beautiful woman and although she and I get along very well we are not meant for romance (she works for me and this is a line I will not cross). Meeting her opened my eyes to the fact that a younger lady, despite her youth, can still posses a significant maturity and certainly a powerful charm.?

It makes sense to me that in this type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a SD (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 41 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being 18-35 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.?

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.?

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the financial rewards. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body and are you open to receive both affection and assistance with your bills and expenses and such? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.

Meeting her opened my eyes to the fact that a younger lady, despite her youth, can still posses a significant maturity and certainly a powerful charm.?

It makes sense to me that in this type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a SD (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 41 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being 18-35 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.?

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.?

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the financial rewards. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body and are you open to receive both affection and assistance with your bills and expenses and such? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.

title: Businessman looking for younger companion for something unique
text:
Giving this a try in the hope of find someone sane and like minded to share a new relationship.

I'll start by explaining that I recently met a superbly thoughtful and beautiful woman and although she and I get along very well we are not meant for romance (she works for me and this is a line I will not cross). Meeting her opened my eyes to the fact that a younger lady, despite her youth, can still posses a significant maturity and certainly a powerful charm.?

It makes sense to me that in this type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a SD (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 41 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being 18-35 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.?

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.?

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the financial rewards. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body and are you open to receive both affection and assistance with your bills and expenses and such? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.

title: Businessman looking for younger companion for something unique
text:
Giving this a try in the hope of find someone sane and like minded to share a new relationship.

I'll start by explaining that I recently met a superbly thoughtful and beautiful woman and although she and I get along very well we are not meant for romance (she works for me and this is a line I will not cross). Meeting her opened my eyes to the fact that a younger lady, despite her youth, can still posses a significant maturity and certainly a powerful charm.?

It makes sense to me that in this type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a SD (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 41 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being 18-35 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.?

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.?

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the financial rewards. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body and are you open to receive both affection and assistance with your bills and expenses and such? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.
